oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Centennial celebrations; Exhibition buildings; Exhibitions; Anniversaries; Commemorations; Events; Fairs; Festivals
Tennessee Centennial and International Exposition (1897 : Nashville, Tenn.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Terminal Building at the Tennessee Centennial and International Exposition. The image features a front and side view of the building. The top of the building carries the lettering "Railway Exhibits." The grounds clearly contain decorative fountains and statuary as well as distinctive plantings.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Calvert Bros. & Taylor
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Terminal Station of the Tennessee Centennial and International Exposition marks the entrance of the Nashville, Chattanooga & St. Louis Railway onto the grounds of the Centennial City. This one hundred foot square building allowed railroad lines to highlight the vegetable and mineral products of the soils that bordered their routes. The states of Kentucky, Tennessee, Alabama, and Georgia were represented. J. B. Killebrew was responsible for the exhibit staged by the Nashville, Chattanooga & St. Louis Railway. Indian and war relics took their place alongside the various agricultural and mineral displays. The tobacco exhibit within these walls warranted particular attention.
